head.title: Princess Cruises Starts Review of Account

identified-content.org: Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation Co
identified-content.object.title: Advertising (Times Column)
identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Hospitality, Restaurant and Travel
Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Marketing, Advertising and PR

hedline.hl1: Princess Cruises Starts Review of Account

abstract.p: Princess Cruises, part of Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation, is beginning closed review for agency of record to handle its account, currently handled by J Walter Thompson (S)

block.p: Princess Cruises, part of Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation, is beginning a closed review for an agency of record to handle its account, with billings estimated at $20 million.

Denise Seomin, a spokeswoman at Princess in Los Angeles, confirmed a report of the review in the online edition of Adweek. She declined to identify the agencies invited to participate other than the incumbent since 1995, the Chicago office of J. Walter Thompson, part of the WPP Group.
Princess Cruises, part of Peninsular and Oriental Steam Navigation, is beginning a closed review for an agency of record to handle its account, with billings estimated at $20 million.

Denise Seomin, a spokeswoman at Princess in Los Angeles, confirmed a report of the review in the online edition of Adweek. She declined to identify the agencies invited to participate other than the incumbent since 1995, the Chicago office of J. Walter Thompson, part of the WPP Group.
Joe Silberman, a spokesman at Thompson Chicago, said the agency would take part.
